result.execSummary:
The defendant Quentin T Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 1 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay for every $50.00 due and owing.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

Defendant Quentin T Patterson in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
PSI reviewed by parties, no additions or corrections made.

14CF1375
BTC: Ct. 1: I/S 3.5 yrs., 1.5 yrs. IC, 2 yrs. ES, 2 yrs. probation, consecutive to Cts. 2 & 3.
Ct. 2: 7.5 yrs., 5 yrs. IC, 2.5 yrs. ES.
Ct. 3: 7.5 yrs., 5 yrs. IC, 2.5 yrs. ES, consecutive to Ct. 2.
Ct. 4: I/S 6 yrs., 3 yrs. IC, 3 yrs. ES, 2 yrs. probation consecutive to Ct. 1.

15CF552
BTC: Ct. 3: 1yr. RCJ, concurrent to Cts. 2 & 3 in 14CF1375, repay costs in 10 years, civil judgment for FTP.
Ct. 4: 9 mos. RCJ, concurrent to Ct. 3 in 14CF1375, repay costs in 10 years, civil judgment for FTP.

Conditions:
Absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances.
Random UA's and breathalyzers.
AODA assessment.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Do not associate with any known felon.
Anger management counseling.
Domestic abuse evaluation and counseling.
Pay the debt to RCAP of $2,900.20 while on ES. 
Pay court costs, costs of supervision, surcharges.
DNA sample.
CFTS.

FAW/VOTE.

Not eligible for CIP and SAP.

Defendant Quentin T Patterson in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Brett Ekes
Preliminary hearing on April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Quentin T Patterson in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Quentin T Patterson in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
